About Iowa CYP

About the Iowa Child & Youth Program

Iowa CYP is the Guard family's teammate. We make sure kids have places to be brave, goofy, and honest—and that parents have practical support when the calendar fills up with trainings, travel, and everything in between.

Partner With Us Stay in the Loop

Who We Are

Guard family's teammate from drill to homecoming

For more than two decades we've walked alongside Guard-connected youth, giving them trusted mentors, resilient friendships, and experiences that celebrate their role at home.

Our Mission

Show up for Guard-connected kids and caregivers with year-round experiences, practical resources, and caring adults so home life stays steady through every drill, mobilization, and return.

Our Vision

Every Iowa Guard kid feels seen, supported, and ready for what's next — and leaders can point to stronger, steadier families because of it.

Strategic Infrastructure

The systems that keep camps, kits, and outreach running strong.

Behind the scenes we focus on a few steady priorities so camps run smoothly, kits land on doorsteps, and leaders across the state see the impact.

Partnership Cultivation

Grow local and statewide partners who help us stretch funding, add fresh experiences, and keep families covered.

Storytelling & Advocacy

Share real Guard family stories so decision-makers understand the wins, the gaps, and why support matters.

Data Collection & Outcome Reporting

Track participation and outcomes so we can show readiness, resilience, and retention gains.

Marketing & Visibility

Keep families and leaders in the loop with clear, consistent updates and event branding.

Core Values

How we show up for Guard families every day.

These values guide how we plan, partner, and deliver—whether we’re in a school gym, on the road, or huddled with parents over coffee.

Mission Ready

What we do at camp, in schools, and online directly supports Guard families and the Guard mission.

Hospitality Hearted

We welcome every family member like they're walking into our own living room.

Problem Solvers

We listen, adapt, and create what families actually need in a fast-changing world.

Trustworthy

We steward trust, time, and funding with excellence.

Meet the Team

Youth program pros who plan shoulder-to-shoulder with Iowa Guard families.

Our staff includes coordinators, coaches, and camp leads who grew up in military households or have served alongside them. We stay on the road, on the phone, and online so every family has a direct line to someone who gets it.

Reach the CYP Office

  • Main Phone: 515-252-4050
  • Inbox: iaarngcyp@gmail.com

Chris Cox

Lead Child & Youth Program Coordinator

JTSI Contractor

Chris Cox leads the Iowa Army National Guard Child & Youth Program. He grew up in a Guard family and knows firsthand how much encouragement matters. Chris loves building experiences where military-connected youth can be themselves, learn new skills, and feel proud of the role they play at home.

  • Email: christopher.j.cox18.ctr@army.mil
  • Phone: 515-727-3064
Facebook Instagram

Erin Coogler

Child & Youth Program Coordinator

JTSI Contractor

Erin Coogler is a Program Coordinator who brings a child-development background and a big heart for Guard families. She designs camps, kits, and trainings that feel welcoming, practical, and fun—so every young person walks away more confident and connected.

  • Email: iaarngcyp@gmail.com
  • Phone: 515-252-4050

Stay Connected

Grab the Iowa National Guard mobile app.

Turn on push alerts for new CYP events, quick access to resources, and reminders that keep your family synced with Guard updates.

About Iowa CYP

Fostering community, resilience, and positive development among Iowa's military-connected children and families.
